required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Smile Esthetics in Orthodontically Treated Patients With Bimaxillary-dentoalveolar Protrusion
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Smile Esthetics in Orthodontically Treated Adult Female Patients With Bimaxillary-dentoalveolar Protrusion: A Retrospective Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Evaluation of Smile Esthetics in Orthodontically Treated Adult Female Patients with Bimaxillary-dentoalveolar Protrusion.
A Retrospective Cohort Study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline gingival display, at an average 24 months
primary_outcome.description: Amount of maxillary gingival exposure between inferior border of upper lip and marginal gingiva of maxillary central incisors.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline lateral negative space, at an average 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The buccal corridor between the posterior teeth and the corner of the mouth in smiling.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline smile arc, at an average 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Relationship between a hypothetical curve drawn along The edges of the maxillary anterior teeth and the inner contour of the lower lip in the posed smile.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline lip line, at an average 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The height of the upper lip relative to the maxillary central incisors.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline smile width, at an average 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The distance between the most medial points on the lips at the angles of the mouth (Left to right cheilion, CHR to CHL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline smile height, at an average 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Distance from the most inferior point on the upper lip between the maxillary central inciors to the most superior point on the lower lip on a perpendicular vertical line from the upper point (upper stomion to lower stomion,UST to LST).

study_pop.textblock: Study models of orthodontically treated Egyptian adult female patients with bimaxillary dentoalveolar protrusion .

criteria.textblock:
The selected records should meet the following inclusion criteria:
Pre treatment:
1. Full permanent dentition
2. No dental nor any craniofacial anomalies
3. Molar Class I with bimaxillary-dentoalveolar protrusion
4. No excessive over jet or overbite
Treatment mechanics:
1. All patients treated with extraction of four 1st premolars
2. Retraction of anterior teeth using maximum anchorage mechanics
Post treatment:
1. Canine 1 relation
2. Molar I relation
Exclusion criteria :
Any orthodontic records without the previously mentioned pre and posttreatment inclusion criteria

eligibility.gender_description: Adult Egyptian females with bimaxillary-dentoalveolar protrusion.
